alert.note: Alert for Noble (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 11:51AM EST until March 03 at 1:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Maumee River near Defiance affecting Henry and Defiance Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Indiana... Saint Joseph River Ohio below Montpelier affecting Williams County. North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville affecting Noble County. Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Fulton OH, Defiance and Williams Counties. .Rises on area rivers occurred as a result of recent rainfall. Another system later this week is expected to create additional rises on area rivers as well. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Water approaches some houses around Skinner Lake, especially along State Road 8. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EST Tuesday was 6.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
